intro: Moenchia, commonly known as silverleaf goosefoot, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves that are typically silver or blue-green in color. The plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Moenchia species are generally annual or biennial herbs with small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. They are sometimes cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage.
